cards.text: Lowering your gaze protects your heart and preserves your inner peace.
The gaze is a poisoned arrow. Whoever averts it for Allah's sake will find sweetness in their heart.
Do not approach what leads to temptation. Boundaries exist to protect you.
The unlawful gaze is a form of transgression of the heart. Guard what you let in.
Never despair of Allah's mercy. He forgives all sins without exception.
Allah rejoices at His servant's repentance more than a traveler who finds his lost mount in the desert.
Every day is a new chance. Sincere repentance erases what came before.
Fasting is a shield. It protects against desires and strengthens willpower.
Preserve your chastity and integrity. It is a treasure that enriches the soul.
True strength is not physical—it's the ability to control yourself in moments of anger and desire.
With every difficulty comes ease. You will get through this moment.
Allah does not burden a soul beyond its capacity. You can do this.
The door of repentance remains open until the last breath. It's never too late.
Patience is a light. It illuminates the path in dark moments.
Those who are patient will receive their reward without measure.
Every trial overcome with patience elevates your rank. Keep resisting.
The eyes are the gates to the heart. What you choose to look at shapes who you become.
Avoid places and moments of weakness. Prevention is easier than cure.
When you fall, get up and return. Allah loves those who constantly turn back to Him.
Whoever guards their tongue and their modesty, I guarantee them Paradise.
Allah is with those who are patient. You are never alone in your struggle.
The strong believer is better than the weak believer, but there is good in both.
Every time you avert your gaze, you strengthen your will and spiritual connection.
The wise avoid slippery paths before falling on them.
A sin that makes you return to Allah is better than obedience that distances you through pride.
The soul is like a child: if left undisciplined, it grows in disorder.
Don't look at the smallness of your sin—look at the greatness of the One to whom you repent.
Victory comes with patience, and relief comes with hardship.
Your gaze belongs to you. Use it to see what is beautiful and pure.
Every click is a choice. Choose what brings you closer to peace.
The one who repents from sin is like one who has not sinned.
Small daily victories build great transformations.
